text: this is only a test the alarm will sound
the alarm is loud there's smoke alarm
hushed I'm done wertham with the New
York Times I have to admit I have a
pretty rocky relationship with smoke
detectors I usually end up ripping them
out of the wall but this week I'm
reviewing a product that could possibly
change all that the nest protect is a
carbon monoxide detector and smoke
alarms rolled into one it's pretty cute
looking and it has some cool features as
well emergency the nest protect is a
smart device so it can send alerts and
updates directly to your smartphone and
it can also tell you exactly what's
going on the smartphone updates are
handy for keeping tabs on your home
while you're away but you can we shut
the alarm off in person the protect is a
new generation of Internet connected
alarms and it's a vast improvement over
most other options the biggest downside
for me was the price at $130 the nest
protect cost about four times as much as
the average smoke detector / carbon
monoxide alarm and there's lots of
things I'd rather spend that money on
but I would recommend it to friends who
have children or pets
